Reviews.Title: “Sheraton 4 Points Was Great”
Reviews.Author: KYTravelers2010
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, well-appointed room, English-speaking attendants at the desk, and just a short walk to the Glories metro station. Close-by are lots of local eating options, and the Glories Mall if you're into shopping. We were very happy with our stay in this quiet, safe-feeling location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than basic”
Reviews.Author: Rjc-UK
Reviews.Content: For a basic, business oriented hotel this over-performs the official 3* rating. My room was quite spacious, bed comfortable with a good bathroom. The hotel was clean throughout, breakfast was a good quality and a glass of wine at the bar was reasonably priced. Ok the public areas are not extensive or luxurious, reception is not huge (I wouldn't like to be checking in or out if busy) and the presence of a security guard rather than a concierge could either be reassuring or vaguely unsettling depending on your point of view. Location in a mixed business and residential district is handy for many of the offices in the vicinity and within a 10 minute walk of two metro stations. The residential streets and Poblenou area are charming with a local feel and its about a kilometer to the beach. This is not the tourist end of town (a good thing IMHO) but the gothic old town is only a few metro stops away. If you want to be on top of all the attractions and nightlife then perhaps not for you - but if you are doing business locally or fancy being based somewhere a bit less frenetic then you could do much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevbear61
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and very well run. The staff are very friendly and always have a smile for you. The rooms are a good size and the beds are very comfortable. Even though it is located on Avenida Diagonal, which is a busy road, once you are inside the hotel you do not notice the traffic. A short walk to Glories where you can take the Metro right into the center of Placa de Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Funny you should ask...”
Reviews.Author: smkarizona
Reviews.Content: ...and when it was good, it was very good (the bed), and when it was bad, it was horrid (the wi-fi). Although service was efficient, I wouldn't call it friendly or welcoming. The bed was fantastic. To have free wi-fi is not enough I say...it should be wi-fi with a good signal, good bandwidth and the ability to stay connect for a decent period of time. You have to continually log back in to keep your connection, which is a total wi-fi FAIL for me. The location, proximity to metro and the fantastic neighborhood push this to a four, otherwise would have called it a solid THREE.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable business hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: kbaerliny
Reviews.Content: There is comfort in knowing that certain standards are met when staying with branded hotels, and this is exactly how I would describe this typical Sheraton Four Points. Location is in a relatively residential part of town which was perfect for us as our purpose was to visit with family living about three walking blocks away. The hotel is clean with relatively small but perfectly adequate rooms. We did not have breakfast but it looked very nice. Front Desk staff was helpful and the housekeeping staff most accomodating. You have everything you could possibly want within a 10 minute walk and public transportaion as well as plenty of taxis are directly outside the front door. We would certainly stay here again if we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than most Four Points--but still a Four Points”
Reviews.Author: InNYfromGA
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 9AM on a rainy day in April for a short business trip. There was one guy working the front desk. It took about 25 minutes to check in; slightly irritating when you've been flying all night and you'd like to sleep. My rate included breakfast. The breakfast buffet was decent--probably worth 10-15 Euros. The buffet doesn't start until 7AM, which is a little late to be a business hotel. Platinum status with Starwood earned free internet and no different room than any of my non-platinum co-workers. You get "upgraded" to a higher floor but the rooms were identical. I will admit, the internet was fast. I think the hotel has 15 rooms on each floor. 11 floors total. The hotel hadn't "turned their air conditioner on yet" so I was only able to open a window. If you turn your AC on, a fan only blows--opening a window then turns your AC off. I think it's ridiculous that a hotel doesn't allow guests to use a functioning air conditioner in April. Contsruction lasted for probably four hours through the morning. Staff told us they were working on the top floor or roof. Sounded like a drill bit on brick. The room itself was basic but very clean. Normal layout where you enter the room with the bathroom near the entrance. The queen sized bed was very comfortable--moreso than many European hotels. The area around hotel has very cheap food and drink options. The closer you get to "los ramblas" (the tourist area where all the action is) prices go up. A coffee and a croissant around the hotel was only 2-3 Euros. Four Points is nowhere near los ramblas--probably a 40 minute walk. There's a beautiful W on the water. I may try that next time. All said and done the Four Points isn't that bad. I'll give it 3 out of 5 stars--even though the construction and lack of a cool AC kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Connor and Blenks Vacation Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: Hotel was immaculate, rooms spacious, bathroom trendy, clean and way above adequate, location very good. Beds were exceptionally comfortable and high quality bed linen made them a pleasure to sleep in. Public transport was easily accessible located just over the road with buses very regular even late at night. Perfect for a stroll in the sunshine to the nearby beach and marina approx 20 minutes away. Nearest bar and shops less than one minutes walk away. We only tried the breakfast in the hotel but there was plenty of choice and when the area was about to close the waitress would let you know so you could go and fill up again if you wanted. The staff in the restaurant and reception were very helpful and extremely polite always ensuring you had all you needed. The hotel in my eyes should be rated higher than a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Blbovka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in March 2012. £70 a night, plus 1 night free with points. I had expected this to be further out and more awkwardly situated for visiting Barcelona - the reason for staying was getting a free night with our membership points. But after staying I would recommend it for anyone. The location is really not that far away, the metro is less than 10 minutes walk away which opens up the whole city anyway, but also from here we walked down the beach and back and also up to the sagrada familia.... if you like walking. The hotel itself was very nice, from our room we could see the sagrada familia. As you would expect from this chain the rooms are modern and clean. We didn't try the food in the restuarant but the drinks were reasonably priced and my husband said the beer was the best he got on the trip. Just around the corner down the road Tangers there is a wonderful little place for breakfast and plenty other restuarants around, as well as a food court at the shopping centre just 5 minutes away. Before we left I had booked another more central hotel for the last 4 nights and I found myself wanting to be back here!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: J-and-M-on-tour
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel when it was the Amrey Diagonal, in the summer of 2011. It's in Poble Neu, which is lovely & very well serviced with transport (trams, metro, buses). It's an up & coming area - media types & professional couples really. It changed hands between when we booked & when we went, but we didn't pay much attention to this as it was only for a weekend break. It was lovely!! Really nice staff, lovely rooms, small but adequate bar, nice buffet lunch & quite reasonably priced. Breakfast was good - although we were lazy & had it in our room so we could watch the half marathon from the window! The room was well equipped, with a good bathroom (shower, bidet) a good size wardrobe, safe, free bottled water, a good tv - what more do you need? It's very reasonably priced, a little outside the main city, but only 10 euros from the Born in a taxi. We're hoping to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our city break”
Reviews.Author: marko05
Reviews.Content: A wonderful clean and modern hotel with friendly and helpful staff. We had three nights in a standard room which was anything but standard. Spotless bathroom with bath and shower plus bidet. bedroom with flat screen tv, safe and fridge, plus the comfiest beds i have slept in. Breakfast was an adequate buffet. Location was fine and felt safe. Bus number 7 outside hotel takes you to city center or the metro station at Glories is no more that ten minutes pleasant walk. Be careful if you take a taxi from the airport on arrival. We were charged fifty euros which we thought was a rip off. Going home we took the aerobus fron Catalunya square which is five euros each. Many thanks to the staff at Four Points for such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Osborne51
Reviews.Content: While officially a 3 star, this hotel is easily better than that. Friendly and efficient service, excellent food (and not particularly expensive, for the Eurozone), first class room - we couldn't fault it. Highly recommended for a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: DuFFi_SK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the commercial area near the big shopping mall. It is 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest metro station which can take you to the centre of the city. The neighbourhood is clean and safe. The hotel itself was nice, the reception staff friendly and everything was OK. We stayed there for three nights and we did not have breakfast (there is no problem to buy anything in the shopping mall - just 5 minutes outside from the hotel). We had a nice and clean room with a perfect view. If you don't need to be exactly in the center of the city, this hotel might be the good choice for you. (I recommend a trip to beautiful Montserrat)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tyndale77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in late Dec 2012. When we checked in we were told by the person at the reception desk that Barcelona would be quiet before on New Year’s Eve, things shut down by afternoon and that we should be prepared etc. We were quite discouraged and even considered flying back to our home country earlier. However we later met with a very helpful staff at the reception (Mr Alvariez) who was very helpful in assisting us to explore the city and giving excellent tips on getting around Barcelona and restaurants. The hotel is located near the Glories mall (a good place for shopping) and has some nice restaurants of different cuisines within walking distance. There is also a super market nearby. The tour bus pick up point is also near the Glories mall. We purchased tickets for the tour bus from the hotel. We also purchased tickets for the flamenco dance from the concierge. It’s been less than 6 months since the hotel is part of the Sheraton group. As a result you can see the integration to the Sheraton standard happening slowly (almost there) .The breakfast is decent, though I wished they could have more local fare included. Housekeeping could improve - I found tangled hair on the hair dryer (ugh!) when we checked-in to the room and the bed would be made differently every day. Hope the hotel can pay more attention to such details. But other than these, overall we had a good experience staying at the hotel, thanks to the polite and helpful staff. If you are looking for being where the action is then Catalunya or La Ramblas is the place to be. However, if you are looking a quieter place, this hotel is a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money; Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Aditithetraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located and has all basic amenities. It is no-frills which helps it keep an affordable rate. The staff is efficient and very sweet. We were there in Dec and Jan 2012. I would recommend to others too! One suggestion: The breakfast could have more variety everyday.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommend . . .”
Reviews.Author: dwild2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our way back from Mallorca. Hotel has a definite mark for Sheraton's high standard. From professional, friendly and helpful staff to high standard living spaces. Hotel location is perfect for shopping -- Glories shopping mall is just across the street. Plenty of nice restaurant within walking distance. Private and secure parking is available. A short walk to Glories metro station. As starwood preferred gold member, we were given a room upgrade ??? -- second floor facing the street. The room was spacious, flat screen TV, working desk, clean, well equipped bathroom, huge super comfortable bed. But then again, huge-heavenly bed is Sheraton's standard. But because it was on the second floor facing the street, it was a little loud at night time. Nevertheless, it did not stop us from getting a goodnight sleep. We would have preferred to get a "real upgrade" to the upper floor with a nicer view -- but then again, we hardly stayed in the room . . .. so much to do and explore in Barcelona. Overall, we were very much satisfied with our stay and definitely recommend this hotel with high score.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: becks2009
Reviews.Content: This a beautiful hotel ,so clean and friendly staff , you cannot fault this place , and close to glories station which u can get all over Barcelona ,would defo go bk

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: drsharonleed
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay; and were even allowed an early check in upon arrival- which made the stay even better. Staff was very helpful. Grocery store right across the street for snacks. Convenient for transportation. Very clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back !”
Reviews.Author: N0rwegianTravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night, as I have also booked up with 2 other hotels for this holiday. This is the first time I have booked a Starwood hotel as most of my hotels stays are with the Holiday inn chain. However, I will certainly stay again as this was a very good start. I was allocated the top floor with a view to the sea. Very good as I think room on the Avenida Diagonal side would certainly have more noise, as this is a very busy street. The room size was OK , and the bed was fantastic. Possible one of the best bed I have ever slept inn. The Front desk was very good, and the breakfast which I ordered with my booking was OK. There are 2 free computers in the basement , but only one of them was working. However, there was a one big problem on my night. I came down 8 pm to use the computer and it was occupied by a woman. I went back to my room and returned again 22.45 and the same woman was still sitting on the PC ! I asked her if she could finish as she had been using the PC for 3 hours and she told me: "5 minutes more ". I told her to get off the PC now , as I wanted to use it now . No reply. Then I asked her : Are you a guest of the hotel ? Well , she wasn´t !!. So she went , and I informed the reception that they need to check sometimes that the users are guest of the hotel. If not, people will come back and use it for free. I hope the hotel will look after this in the future. The Poble Nou is very nice area and this hotel is located on the corner of Rambla de Poble Nou. A very nice street which has a great range of small shops and take you down to the beach in 15 minutes walk. Highly recommended to explore the area around this street on both sides. I will certainly stay at this hotel again and I have no problem to recommend this hotel to my readers !

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. Recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: A newly renovated hotel. About 10-15 mins walk to Glories station. Very clean room. Huge bed and huge bathroom. Free wifi. Supermarket across the street. 5 mins walk to Glories mall. Would stay again but not very fond of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience on my latest visit to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bren53Cork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after booking hotel with ---- has been recently taken over by Sheraton and was delighted with my stay from check-out to leaving my room was on the 10th floor so i had a good view towards Rambla Poble Nou and the sea in the distance. My room had everything one could ask for and had one of the most comfortable beds i have encountered in a long while. The breakfast was served on the ground floor with view onto Avenida Diagonal. It is easy to get to the hotel by train and get off at Clot metro station the hotel is about 10-15 mins walk. The hotel is away from the main centre but if the weather is nice the Port is within a short walk from the hotel, also there is Glories shopping centre and some nice cafes and restaurants/bars near hotel. I would have no hesitation of recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: PPPEssexEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Nov 2011. We booked via easy jet holidays. I can’t praise this hotel enough. First thing to note is that the name has changed and it is now called FOUR POINTS by SHERATON. [Not sure why they still use Avenida Diagonal, on the internet] The staff were very very helpful on our arrival. Our room was large, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was ‘fantastic’. The location is also superb. The nearest ‘tube’ station is a 8 minute walk away and is called GLORIES. When you come out of the ‘tube’ on to the road, you know where you are as one of the landmarks of the city is in front of you . It is Barcelona’s ‘cucumber’ building. [ It looks wonderful at night, when it is well lit]. Barcelona is an easy city to get around. Almost at the front of the hotel, you can get buses, and trams. If you like walking, this hotel is well placed. We walked into the city via the Olympic park and beach and walked down hill, from Gaudi’s Park Guell and via his famous designed church – Sagrada Familia. Across the road from the hotel there is supermarket and just 5 mins away is a small shopping centre. This is a nice city for a short break and this hotel is EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Fantastic Stay - Thank you to the Friendly Team”
Reviews.Author: Nitesh_Pandey
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Paris-Rome-Barcelona for our vacation....and was not sure if we should have gone to Barcelona or to madrid....but to be true....it became the best part of our vacation and all credit goes to the fantastic team at the Four Point Sheraton, Barcelona. The Front Desk, Housekeeping and Food & Beverage team are just fantastic. Very very friendly and ready to help you any way they can. Special credit goes to Julio Cesar from the Front Desk, he went all out to help us in each of our query. Even while he was very busy at the front desk, he took out time to show us the places to see around the city, its timings, etc etc. I am sure the GM and the management team have focussed a lot on training and you can see the same...... Room is fantastic.... (actually, we are currently in the hotel),....very clean and fresh....beautiful view from the 9th floor....very good location.... we also received an early check-in even before asking and it was of great help...as we were travelling with a baby... will recommend to all travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sendaiben
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night in November 2011. Impressions as below: The good: professional, friendly staff clean and bright room (I was upgraded to Comfort room on the 7th floor with a view of La Sagrada Familia in the distance) metro/tram/bus nearby The bad: for a new hotel (opened Oct 2011) it is showing its age: shower was old, leaky, had shower curtain that clings to you halfway through, etc. Hallways, carpets, etc. also a bit worn. Expected more from them in this regard. Overall: This is a reasonable and pleasant hotel with friendly staff, a few stops on the subway from downtown Barcelona. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely consider the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, close to metro & tram, super cozy bed.”
Reviews.Author: JulietteMarie
Reviews.Content: I like this location a lot, by the Rambla of the Poblenou where one can walk without worries; unlike other places in Barcelona. The new beds (as they converted to Sheraton in October) are divine! The tram & metro are close-by and they take you to every attraction around Barcelona within minutes. The breakfast at the hotel is ok, same selections everyday, but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat chaotic check-in but great night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: AnaBaile
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the hotel was short on staff and/or there were computer problems, but there was only one person checking in guests and this made check in quite lengthy while we waited for the couple ahead of us. Felt sorry for the couple waiting behind us too. We were travelling with our son and had booked a 3 person room. The couple ahead of us paid 75 E for their room, ours was 120 E. (And ours did NOT include breakfast.) That was a bit disappointing since, although they had moved a third bed into the room, there was no third towel or enough toiletries for a third person. They were quite slow to rectify this upon request. However, the room was clean and quiet even though it was on the street side. We slept very well, and isn't that the point???? Parking was not too bad (16 E per night) considering other prices we had seen, but you had better be good at parking to get into the tiny spaces in garages in Europe! Bring your shoehorn. The hotel halls and elevator have a funky blue light thing going on and weird music. I have no clue why. And even though we were on the first floor, we had to take the elevator as stairways were locked. They also were having some elevator problems and one of the two was out of service off and on during our stay. We did stay both nights we had booked. Loved Barcelona and all the sights, the food, the kind people.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Barcelona Diagonal
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Diagonal 161-163, 08018 Barcelona, Spain
